ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I will recommend GG536 to other students, because this course is really useful, and Prof. Smith's teaching is really excellent.
If somebody wants to understand atmospheric phenomena based on wave characteristics, I strongly recommend this class.
Yes, I recommend this course very much.

If you have an excellent physical background (even perhaps without fluids, though better to have taken an intro fluids class) and are interested in the course material, go for it. Keep in mind that it's mostly confined to the atmosphere, so if you're looking for convection in other materials -- this is not where you'll learn it.
I would strongly recommend this course to any student studying atmospheric, oceanic and climate dynamics.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course is helpful, because my research is partly based on fluid mechanics. This course has greatly strengthen my fluid mechanics background.
It's really helpful to my later research!
The insights into atmospheric movements, especially convection and waves, are incredibly important to understanding my work and the work of the other AOCD students.
